00056 const char *sptlrpc_part2name(enum lustre_sec_part part)
00057 {
00058         switch (part) {
00059         case LUSTRE_SP_CLI:
00060                 return "cli";
00061         case LUSTRE_SP_MDT:
00062                 return "mdt";
00063         case LUSTRE_SP_OST:
00064                 return "ost";
00065         case LUSTRE_SP_MGC:
00066                 return "mgc";
00067         case LUSTRE_SP_MGS:
00068                 return "mgs";
00069         case LUSTRE_SP_ANY:
00070                 return "any";
00071         default:
00072                 return "err";
00073         }
00074 }
00075 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_part2name);
00076 
00077 enum lustre_sec_part sptlrpc_target_sec_part(struct obd_device *obd)
00078 {
00079         const char *type = obd->obd_type->typ_name;
00080 
00081         if (!strcmp(type, LUSTRE_MDT_NAME))
00082                 return LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00083         if (!strcmp(type, LUSTRE_OST_NAME))
00084                 return LUSTRE_SP_OST;
00085         if (!strcmp(type, LUSTRE_MGS_NAME))
00086                 return LUSTRE_SP_MGS;
00087 
00088         CERROR("unknown target %p(%s)\n", obd, type);
00089         return LUSTRE_SP_ANY;
00090 }

00092 /****************************************
00093  * user supplied flavor string parsing  *
00094  ****************************************/
00095 
00096 /*
00097  * format: <base_flavor>[-<bulk_type:alg_spec>]
00098  */
00099 int sptlrpc_parse_flavor(const char *str, struct sptlrpc_flavor *flvr)
00100 {
00101         char            buf[32];
00102         char           *bulk, *alg;
00103 
00104         memset(flvr, 0, sizeof(*flvr));
00105 
00106         if (str == NULL || str[0] == '\0') {
00107                 flvr->sf_rpc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID;
00108                 return 0;
00109         }
00110 
00111         strlcpy(buf, str, sizeof(buf));
00112 
00113         bulk = strchr(buf, '-');
00114         if (bulk)
00115                 *bulk++ = '\0';
00116 
00117         flvr->sf_rpc = sptlrpc_name2flavor_base(buf);
00118         if (flvr->sf_rpc == SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID)
00119                 goto err_out;
00120 
00121         /*
00122          * currently only base flavor "plain" can have bulk specification.
00123          */
00124         if (flvr->sf_rpc == SPTLRPC_FLVR_PLAIN) {
00125                 flvr->u_bulk.hash.hash_alg = BULK_HASH_ALG_ADLER32;
00126                 if (bulk) {
00127                         /*
00128                          * format: plain-hash:<hash_alg>
00129                          */
00130                         alg = strchr(bulk, ':');
00131                         if (alg == NULL)
00132                                 goto err_out;
00133                         *alg++ = '\0';
00134 
00135                         if (strcmp(bulk, "hash"))
00136                                 goto err_out;
00137 
00138                         flvr->u_bulk.hash.hash_alg = sptlrpc_get_hash_alg(alg);
00139                         if (flvr->u_bulk.hash.hash_alg >= BULK_HASH_ALG_MAX)
00140                                 goto err_out;
00141                 }
00142 
00143                 if (flvr->u_bulk.hash.hash_alg == BULK_HASH_ALG_NULL)
00144                         flvr_set_bulk_svc(&flvr->sf_rpc, SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_NULL);
00145                 else
00146                         flvr_set_bulk_svc(&flvr->sf_rpc, SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_INTG);
00147         } else {
00148                 if (bulk)
00149                         goto err_out;
00150         }
00151 
00152         flvr->sf_flags = 0;
00153         return 0;
00154 
00155 err_out:
00156         CERROR("invalid flavor string: %s\n", str);
00157         return -EINVAL;
00158 }
00159 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_parse_flavor);
00160 
00161 /****************************************
00162  * configure rules                      *
00163  ****************************************/
00164 
00165 static void get_default_flavor(struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf)
00166 {
00167         memset(sf, 0, sizeof(*sf));
00168 
00169         sf->sf_rpc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_NULL;
00170         sf->sf_flags = 0;
00171 }
00172 
00173 static void sptlrpc_rule_init(struct sptlrpc_rule *rule)
00174 {
00175         rule->sr_netid = LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY);
00176         rule->sr_from = LUSTRE_SP_ANY;
00177         rule->sr_to = LUSTRE_SP_ANY;
00178         rule->sr_padding = 0;
00179 
00180         get_default_flavor(&rule->sr_flvr);
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*
00184  * format: network[.direction]=flavor
00185  */
00186 int sptlrpc_parse_rule(char *param, struct sptlrpc_rule *rule)
00187 {
00188         char           *flavor, *dir;
00189         int             rc;
00190 
00191         sptlrpc_rule_init(rule);
00192 
00193         flavor = strchr(param, '=');
00194         if (flavor == NULL) {
00195                 CERROR("invalid param, no '='\n");
00196                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00197         }
00198         *flavor++ = '\0';
00199 
00200         dir = strchr(param, '.');
00201         if (dir)
00202                 *dir++ = '\0';
00203 
00204         /* 1.1 network */
00205         if (strcmp(param, "default")) {
00206                 rule->sr_netid = libcfs_str2net(param);
00207                 if (rule->sr_netid == LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY)) {
00208                         CERROR("invalid network name: %s\n", param);
00209                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00210                 }
00211         }
00212 
00213         /* 1.2 direction */
00214         if (dir) {
00215                 if (!strcmp(dir, "mdt2ost")) {
00216                         rule->sr_from = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00217                         rule->sr_to = LUSTRE_SP_OST;
00218                 } else if (!strcmp(dir, "mdt2mdt")) {
00219                         rule->sr_from = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00220                         rule->sr_to = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00221                 } else if (!strcmp(dir, "cli2ost")) {
00222                         rule->sr_from = LUSTRE_SP_CLI;
00223                         rule->sr_to = LUSTRE_SP_OST;
00224                 } else if (!strcmp(dir, "cli2mdt")) {
00225                         rule->sr_from = LUSTRE_SP_CLI;
00226                         rule->sr_to = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00227                 } else {
00228                         CERROR("invalid rule dir segment: %s\n", dir);
00229                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00230                 }
00231         }
00232 
00233         /* 2.1 flavor */
00234         rc = sptlrpc_parse_flavor(flavor, &rule->sr_flvr);
00235         if (rc)
00236                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00237 
00238         RETURN(0);
00239 }
00240 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_parse_rule);
00241 
00242 void sptlrpc_rule_set_free(struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset)
00243 {
00244         LASSERT(rset->srs_nslot ||
00245                 (rset->srs_nrule == 0 && rset->srs_rules == NULL));
00246 
00247         if (rset->srs_nslot) {
00248                 OBD_FREE(rset->srs_rules,
00249                          rset->srs_nslot * sizeof(*rset->srs_rules));
00250                 sptlrpc_rule_set_init(rset);
00251         }
00252 }
00253 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_rule_set_free);
00254 
00255 /*
00256  * return 0 if the rule set could accomodate one more rule.
00257  */
00258 int sptlrpc_rule_set_expand(struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset)
00259 {
00260         struct sptlrpc_rule *rules;
00261         int nslot;
00262 
00263         might_sleep();
00264 
00265         if (rset->srs_nrule < rset->srs_nslot)
00266                 return 0;
00267 
00268         nslot = rset->srs_nslot + 8;
00269 
00270         /* better use realloc() if available */
00271         OBD_ALLOC(rules, nslot * sizeof(*rset->srs_rules));
00272         if (rules == NULL)
00273                 return -ENOMEM;
00274 
00275         if (rset->srs_nrule) {
00276                 LASSERT(rset->srs_nslot && rset->srs_rules);
00277                 memcpy(rules, rset->srs_rules,
00278                        rset->srs_nrule * sizeof(*rset->srs_rules));
00279 
00280                 OBD_FREE(rset->srs_rules,
00281                          rset->srs_nslot * sizeof(*rset->srs_rules));
00282         }
00283 
00284         rset->srs_rules = rules;
00285         rset->srs_nslot = nslot;
00286         return 0;
00287 }
00288 
00289 static inline int rule_spec_dir(struct sptlrpc_rule *rule)
00290 {
00291         return (rule->sr_from != LUSTRE_SP_ANY ||
00292                 rule->sr_to != LUSTRE_SP_ANY);
00293 }
00294 static inline int rule_spec_net(struct sptlrpc_rule *rule)
00295 {
00296         return (rule->sr_netid != LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY));
00297 }
00298 static inline int rule_match_dir(struct sptlrpc_rule *r1,
00299                                  struct sptlrpc_rule *r2)
00300 {
00301         return (r1->sr_from == r2->sr_from && r1->sr_to == r2->sr_to);
00302 }
00303 static inline int rule_match_net(struct sptlrpc_rule *r1,
00304                                  struct sptlrpc_rule *r2)
00305 {
00306         return (r1->sr_netid == r2->sr_netid);
00307 }
00308 
00309 /*
00310  * merge @rule into @rset.
00311  * the @rset slots might be expanded.
00312  */
00313 int sptlrpc_rule_set_merge(struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset, 
00314                            struct sptlrpc_rule *rule)
00315 {
00316         struct sptlrpc_rule      *p = rset->srs_rules;
00317         int                       spec_dir, spec_net;
00318         int                       rc, n, match = 0;
00319 
00320         might_sleep();
00321 
00322         spec_net = rule_spec_net(rule);
00323         spec_dir = rule_spec_dir(rule);
00324 
00325         for (n = 0; n < rset->srs_nrule; n++) {
00326                 p = &rset->srs_rules[n]; 
00327 
00328                 /* test network match, if failed:
00329                  * - spec rule: skip rules which is also spec rule match, until
00330                  *   we hit a wild rule, which means no more chance
00331                  * - wild rule: skip until reach the one which is also wild
00332                  *   and matches
00333                  */
00334                 if (!rule_match_net(p, rule)) {
00335                         if (spec_net) {
00336                                 if (rule_spec_net(p))
00337                                         continue;
00338                                 else
00339                                         break;
00340                         } else {
00341                                 continue;
00342                         }
00343                 }
00344 
00345                 /* test dir match, same logic as net matching */
00346                 if (!rule_match_dir(p, rule)) {
00347                         if (spec_dir) {
00348                                 if (rule_spec_dir(p))
00349                                         continue;
00350                                 else
00351                                         break;
00352                         } else {
00353                                 continue;
00354                         }
00355                 }
00356 
00357                 /* find a match */
00358                 match = 1;
00359                 break;
00360         }
00361 
00362         if (match) {
00363                 LASSERT(n >= 0 && n < rset->srs_nrule);
00364 
00365                 if (rule->sr_flvr.sf_rpc == SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID) {
00366                         /* remove this rule */
00367                         if (n < rset->srs_nrule - 1)
00368                                 memmove(&rset->srs_rules[n],
00369                                         &rset->srs_rules[n + 1],
00370                                         (rset->srs_nrule - n - 1) *
00371                                         sizeof(*rule));
00372                         rset->srs_nrule--;
00373                 } else {
00374                         /* override the rule */
00375                         memcpy(&rset->srs_rules[n], rule, sizeof(*rule));
00376                 }
00377         } else {
00378                 LASSERT(n >= 0 && n <= rset->srs_nrule);
00379 
00380                 if (rule->sr_flvr.sf_rpc != SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID) {
00381                         rc = sptlrpc_rule_set_expand(rset);
00382                         if (rc)
00383                                 return rc;
00384 
00385                         if (n < rset->srs_nrule)
00386                                 memmove(&rset->srs_rules[n + 1],
00387                                         &rset->srs_rules[n],
00388                                         (rset->srs_nrule - n) * sizeof(*rule));
00389                         memcpy(&rset->srs_rules[n], rule, sizeof(*rule));
00390                         rset->srs_nrule++;
00391                 } else {
00392                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "ignore the unmatched deletion\n");
00393                 }
00394         }
00395 
00396         return 0;
00397 }
00398 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_rule_set_merge);
00399 
00404 int sptlrpc_rule_set_choose(struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset,
00405                             enum lustre_sec_part from,
00406                             enum lustre_sec_part to,
00407                             lnet_nid_t nid,
00408                             struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf)
00409 {
00410         struct sptlrpc_rule    *r;
00411         int                     n;
00412 
00413         for (n = 0; n < rset->srs_nrule; n++) {
00414                 r = &rset->srs_rules[n];
00415 
00416                 if (LNET_NIDNET(nid) != LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY) &&
00417                     r->sr_netid != LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY) &&
00418                     LNET_NIDNET(nid) != r->sr_netid)
00419                         continue;
00420 
00421                 if (from != LUSTRE_SP_ANY && r->sr_from != LUSTRE_SP_ANY &&
00422                     from != r->sr_from)
00423                         continue;
00424 
00425                 if (to != LUSTRE_SP_ANY && r->sr_to != LUSTRE_SP_ANY &&
00426                     to != r->sr_to)
00427                         continue;
00428 
00429                 *sf = r->sr_flvr;
00430                 return 1;
00431         }
00432 
00433         return 0;
00434 }
00435 
00436 void sptlrpc_rule_set_dump(struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset)
00437 {
00438         struct sptlrpc_rule *r;
00439         int     n;
00440 
00441         for (n = 0; n < rset->srs_nrule; n++) {
00442                 r = &rset->srs_rules[n];
00443                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "<%02d> from %x to %x, net %x, rpc %x\n", n,
00444                        r->sr_from, r->sr_to, r->sr_netid, r->sr_flvr.sf_rpc);
00445         }
00446 }
00447 
00448 static int sptlrpc_rule_set_extract(struct sptlrpc_rule_set *gen,
00449                                     struct sptlrpc_rule_set *tgt,
00450                                     enum lustre_sec_part from,
00451                                     enum lustre_sec_part to,
00452                                     struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset)
00453 {
00454         struct sptlrpc_rule_set *src[2] = { gen, tgt };
00455         struct sptlrpc_rule     *rule;
00456         int                      i, n, rc;
00457 
00458         might_sleep();
00459 
00460         /* merge general rules firstly, then target-specific rules */
00461         for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00462                 if (src[i] == NULL)
00463                         continue;
00464 
00465                 for (n = 0; n < src[i]->srs_nrule; n++) {
00466                         rule = &src[i]->srs_rules[n];
00467 
00468                         if (from != LUSTRE_SP_ANY &&
00469                             rule->sr_from != LUSTRE_SP_ANY &&
00470                             rule->sr_from != from)
00471                                 continue;
00472                         if (to != LUSTRE_SP_ANY &&
00473                             rule->sr_to != LUSTRE_SP_ANY &&
00474                             rule->sr_to != to)
00475                                 continue;
00476 
00477                         rc = sptlrpc_rule_set_merge(rset, rule);
00478                         if (rc) {
00479                                 CERROR("can't merge: %d\n", rc);
00480                                 return rc;
00481                         }
00482                 }
00483         }
00484 
00485         return 0;
00486 }
00487 
00488 /**********************************
00489  * sptlrpc configuration support  *
00490  **********************************/
00491 
00492 struct sptlrpc_conf_tgt {
00493         struct list_head              sct_list;
00494         char                    sct_name[MAX_OBD_NAME];
00495         struct sptlrpc_rule_set sct_rset;
00496 };
00497 
00498 struct sptlrpc_conf {
00499         struct list_head        sc_list;
00500         char                    sc_fsname[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00501         unsigned int            sc_modified;    /* modified during updating */
00502         unsigned int            sc_updated:1,   /* updated copy from MGS */
00503                                 sc_local:1;     /* local copy from target */
00504         struct sptlrpc_rule_set sc_rset;        /* fs general rules */
00505         struct list_head        sc_tgts;        /* target-specific rules */
00506 };
00507 
00508 static struct mutex sptlrpc_conf_lock;
00509 static struct list_head sptlrpc_confs;
00510 
00511 static inline int is_hex(char c)
00512 {
00513         return ((c >= '0' && c <= '9') ||
00514                 (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f'));
00515 }
00516 
00517 static void target2fsname(const char *tgt, char *fsname, int buflen)
00518 {
00519         const char     *ptr;
00520         int             len;
00521 
00522         ptr = strrchr(tgt, '-');
00523         if (ptr) {
00524                 if ((strncmp(ptr, "-MDT", 4) != 0 &&
00525                      strncmp(ptr, "-OST", 4) != 0) ||
00526                     !is_hex(ptr[4]) || !is_hex(ptr[5]) ||
00527                     !is_hex(ptr[6]) || !is_hex(ptr[7]))
00528                         ptr = NULL;
00529         }
00530 
00531         /* if we didn't find the pattern, treat the whole string as fsname */
00532         if (ptr == NULL)
00533                 len = strlen(tgt);
00534         else
00535                 len = ptr - tgt;
00536 
00537         len = min(len, buflen - 1);
00538         memcpy(fsname, tgt, len);
00539         fsname[len] = '\0';
00540 }
00541 
00542 static void sptlrpc_conf_free_rsets(struct sptlrpc_conf *conf)
00543 {
00544         struct sptlrpc_conf_tgt *conf_tgt, *conf_tgt_next;
00545 
00546         sptlrpc_rule_set_free(&conf->sc_rset);
00547 
00548         list_for_each_entry_safe(conf_tgt, conf_tgt_next,
00549                                  &conf->sc_tgts, sct_list) {
00550                 sptlrpc_rule_set_free(&conf_tgt->sct_rset);
00551                 list_del(&conf_tgt->sct_list);
00552                 OBD_FREE_PTR(conf_tgt);
00553         }
00554         LASSERT(list_empty(&conf->sc_tgts));
00555 
00556         conf->sc_updated = 0;
00557         conf->sc_local = 0;
00558 }
00559 
00560 static void sptlrpc_conf_free(struct sptlrpc_conf *conf)
00561 {
00562         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "free sptlrpc conf %s\n", conf->sc_fsname);
00563 
00564         sptlrpc_conf_free_rsets(conf);
00565         list_del(&conf->sc_list);
00566         OBD_FREE_PTR(conf);
00567 }
00568 
00569 static
00570 struct sptlrpc_conf_tgt *sptlrpc_conf_get_tgt(struct sptlrpc_conf *conf,
00571                                               const char *name,
00572                                               int create)
00573 {
00574         struct sptlrpc_conf_tgt *conf_tgt;
00575 
00576         list_for_each_entry(conf_tgt, &conf->sc_tgts, sct_list) {
00577                 if (strcmp(conf_tgt->sct_name, name) == 0)
00578                         return conf_tgt;
00579         }
00580 
00581         if (!create)
00582                 return NULL;
00583 
00584         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(conf_tgt);
00585         if (conf_tgt) {
00586                 strlcpy(conf_tgt->sct_name, name, sizeof(conf_tgt->sct_name));
00587                 sptlrpc_rule_set_init(&conf_tgt->sct_rset);
00588                 list_add(&conf_tgt->sct_list, &conf->sc_tgts);
00589         }
00590 
00591         return conf_tgt;
00592 }
00593 
00594 static
00595 struct sptlrpc_conf *sptlrpc_conf_get(const char *fsname,
00596                                       int create)
00597 {
00598         struct sptlrpc_conf *conf;
00599 
00600         list_for_each_entry(conf, &sptlrpc_confs, sc_list) {
00601                 if (strcmp(conf->sc_fsname, fsname) == 0)
00602                         return conf;
00603         }
00604 
00605         if (!create)
00606                 return NULL;
00607 
00608         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(conf);
00609         if (conf == NULL)
00610                 return NULL;
00611 
00612         if (strlcpy(conf->sc_fsname, fsname, sizeof(conf->sc_fsname)) >=
00613             sizeof(conf->sc_fsname)) {
00614                 OBD_FREE_PTR(conf);
00615                 return NULL;
00616         }
00617         sptlrpc_rule_set_init(&conf->sc_rset);
00618         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->sc_tgts);
00619         list_add(&conf->sc_list, &sptlrpc_confs);
00620 
00621         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "create sptlrpc conf %s\n", conf->sc_fsname);
00622         return conf;
00623 }
00624 
00628 static int sptlrpc_conf_merge_rule(struct sptlrpc_conf *conf,
00629                                    const char *target,
00630                                    struct sptlrpc_rule *rule)
00631 {
00632         struct sptlrpc_conf_tgt  *conf_tgt;
00633         struct sptlrpc_rule_set  *rule_set;
00634 
00635         /* fsname == target means general rules for the whole fs */
00636         if (strcmp(conf->sc_fsname, target) == 0) {
00637                 rule_set = &conf->sc_rset;
00638         } else {
00639                 conf_tgt = sptlrpc_conf_get_tgt(conf, target, 1);
00640                 if (conf_tgt) {
00641                         rule_set = &conf_tgt->sct_rset;
00642                 } else {
00643                         CERROR("out of memory, can't merge rule!\n");
00644                         return -ENOMEM;
00645                 }
00646         }
00647 
00648         return sptlrpc_rule_set_merge(rule_set, rule);
00649 }
00650 
00656 static int __sptlrpc_process_config(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg,
00657                                     struct sptlrpc_conf *conf)
00658 {
00659         char                   *target, *param;
00660         char                    fsname[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00661         struct sptlrpc_rule     rule;
00662         int                     rc;
00663         ENTRY;
00664 
00665         target = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
00666         if (target == NULL) {
00667                 CERROR("missing target name\n");
00668                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00669         }
00670 
00671         param = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2);
00672         if (param == NULL) {
00673                 CERROR("missing parameter\n");
00674                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00675         }
00676 
00677         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "processing rule: %s.%s\n", target, param);
00678 
00679         /* parse rule to make sure the format is correct */
00680         if (strncmp(param, PARAM_SRPC_FLVR, sizeof(PARAM_SRPC_FLVR) - 1) != 0) {
00681                 CERROR("Invalid sptlrpc parameter: %s\n", param);
00682                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00683         }
00684         param += sizeof(PARAM_SRPC_FLVR) - 1;
00685 
00686         rc = sptlrpc_parse_rule(param, &rule);
00687         if (rc)
00688                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00689 
00690         if (conf == NULL) {
00691                 target2fsname(target, fsname, sizeof(fsname));
00692 
00693                 mutex_lock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00694                 conf = sptlrpc_conf_get(fsname, 0);
00695                 if (conf == NULL) {
00696                         CERROR("can't find conf\n");
00697                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00698                 } else {
00699                         rc = sptlrpc_conf_merge_rule(conf, target, &rule);
00700                 }
00701                 mutex_unlock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00702         } else {
00703                 LASSERT(mutex_is_locked(&sptlrpc_conf_lock));
00704                 rc = sptlrpc_conf_merge_rule(conf, target, &rule);
00705         }
00706 
00707         if (rc == 0)
00708                 conf->sc_modified++;
00709 
00710         RETURN(rc);
00711 }
00712 
00713 int sptlrpc_process_config(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00714 {
00715         return __sptlrpc_process_config(lcfg, NULL);
00716 }
00717 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_process_config);
00718 
00719 static int logname2fsname(const char *logname, char *buf, int buflen)
00720 {
00721         char   *ptr;
00722         int     len;
00723 
00724         ptr = strrchr(logname, '-');
00725         if (ptr == NULL || strcmp(ptr, "-sptlrpc")) {
00726                 CERROR("%s is not a sptlrpc config log\n", logname);
00727                 return -EINVAL;
00728         }
00729 
00730         len = min((int) (ptr - logname), buflen - 1);
00731 
00732         memcpy(buf, logname, len);
00733         buf[len] = '\0';
00734         return 0;
00735 }
00736 
00737 void sptlrpc_conf_log_update_begin(const char *logname)
00738 {
00739         struct sptlrpc_conf *conf;
00740         char                 fsname[16];
00741 
00742         if (logname2fsname(logname, fsname, sizeof(fsname)))
00743                 return;
00744 
00745         mutex_lock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00746 
00747         conf = sptlrpc_conf_get(fsname, 0);
00748         if (conf) {
00749                 if (conf->sc_local) {
00750                         LASSERT(conf->sc_updated == 0);
00751                         sptlrpc_conf_free_rsets(conf);
00752                 }
00753                 conf->sc_modified = 0;
00754         }
00755 
00756         mutex_unlock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00757 }
00758 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_conf_log_update_begin);
00759 
00763 void sptlrpc_conf_log_update_end(const char *logname)
00764 {
00765         struct sptlrpc_conf *conf;
00766         char                 fsname[16];
00767 
00768         if (logname2fsname(logname, fsname, sizeof(fsname)))
00769                 return;
00770 
00771         mutex_lock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00772 
00773         conf = sptlrpc_conf_get(fsname, 0);
00774         if (conf) {
00775                 /*
00776                  * if original state is not updated, make sure the
00777                  * modified counter > 0 to enforce updating local copy.
00778                  */
00779                 if (conf->sc_updated == 0)
00780                         conf->sc_modified++;
00781 
00782                 conf->sc_updated = 1;
00783         }
00784 
00785         mutex_unlock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00786 }
00787 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_conf_log_update_end);
00788 
00789 void sptlrpc_conf_log_start(const char *logname)
00790 {
00791         char                 fsname[16];
00792 
00793         if (logname2fsname(logname, fsname, sizeof(fsname)))
00794                 return;
00795 
00796         mutex_lock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00797         sptlrpc_conf_get(fsname, 1);
00798         mutex_unlock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00799 }
00800 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_conf_log_start);
00801 
00802 void sptlrpc_conf_log_stop(const char *logname)
00803 {
00804         struct sptlrpc_conf *conf;
00805         char                 fsname[16];
00806 
00807         if (logname2fsname(logname, fsname, sizeof(fsname)))
00808                 return;
00809 
00810         mutex_lock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00811         conf = sptlrpc_conf_get(fsname, 0);
00812         if (conf)
00813                 sptlrpc_conf_free(conf);
00814         mutex_unlock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00815 }
00816 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_conf_log_stop);
00817 
00818 static void inline flavor_set_flags(struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf,
00819                                     enum lustre_sec_part from,
00820                                     enum lustre_sec_part to,
00821                                     unsigned int fl_udesc)
00822 {
00823         /*
00824          * null flavor doesn't need to set any flavor, and in fact
00825          * we'd better not do that because everybody share a single sec.
00826          */
00827         if (sf->sf_rpc == SPTLRPC_FLVR_NULL)
00828                 return;
00829 
00830         if (from == LUSTRE_SP_MDT) {
00831                 /* MDT->MDT; MDT->OST */
00832                 sf->sf_flags |= PTLRPC_SEC_FL_ROOTONLY;
00833         } else if (from == LUSTRE_SP_CLI && to == LUSTRE_SP_OST) {
00834                 /* CLI->OST */
00835                 sf->sf_flags |= PTLRPC_SEC_FL_ROOTONLY | PTLRPC_SEC_FL_BULK;
00836         } else if (from == LUSTRE_SP_CLI && to == LUSTRE_SP_MDT) {
00837                 /* CLI->MDT */
00838                 if (fl_udesc && sf->sf_rpc != SPTLRPC_FLVR_NULL)
00839                         sf->sf_flags |= PTLRPC_SEC_FL_UDESC;
00840         }
00841 }
00842 
00843 void sptlrpc_conf_choose_flavor(enum lustre_sec_part from,
00844                                 enum lustre_sec_part to,
00845                                 struct obd_uuid *target,
00846                                 lnet_nid_t nid,
00847                                 struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf)
00848 {
00849         struct sptlrpc_conf     *conf;
00850         struct sptlrpc_conf_tgt *conf_tgt;
00851         char                     name[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00852         int                      len, rc = 0;
00853 
00854         target2fsname(target->uuid, name, sizeof(name));
00855 
00856         mutex_lock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00857 
00858         conf = sptlrpc_conf_get(name, 0);
00859         if (conf == NULL)
00860                 goto out;
00861 
00862         /* convert uuid name (supposed end with _UUID) to target name */
00863         len = strlen(target->uuid);
00864         LASSERT(len > 5);
00865         memcpy(name, target->uuid, len - 5);
00866         name[len - 5] = '\0';
00867 
00868         conf_tgt = sptlrpc_conf_get_tgt(conf, name, 0);
00869         if (conf_tgt) {
00870                 rc = sptlrpc_rule_set_choose(&conf_tgt->sct_rset,
00871                                              from, to, nid, sf);
00872                 if (rc)
00873                         goto out;
00874         }
00875 
00876         rc = sptlrpc_rule_set_choose(&conf->sc_rset, from, to, nid, sf);
00877 out:
00878         mutex_unlock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
00879 
00880         if (rc == 0)
00881                 get_default_flavor(sf);
00882 
00883         flavor_set_flags(sf, from, to, 1);
00884 }
00885 
00890 void sptlrpc_target_choose_flavor(struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset,
00891                                   enum lustre_sec_part from,
00892                                   lnet_nid_t nid,
00893                                   struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf)
00894 {
00895         if (sptlrpc_rule_set_choose(rset, from, LUSTRE_SP_ANY, nid, sf) == 0)
00896                 get_default_flavor(sf);
00897 }
00898 
00899 #define SEC_ADAPT_DELAY         (10)
00900 
00905 void sptlrpc_conf_client_adapt(struct obd_device *obd)
00906 {
00907         struct obd_import  *imp;
00908         ENTRY;
00909 
00910         LASSERT(strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME) == 0 ||
00911                 strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME) == 0 ||
00912                 strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME) == 0 ||
00913                 strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_LWP_NAME) == 0);
00914         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "obd %s\n", obd->u.cli.cl_target_uuid.uuid);
00915 
00916         /* serialize with connect/disconnect import */
00917         down_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
00918 
00919         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00920         if (imp) {
00921                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00922                 if (imp->imp_sec)
00923                         imp->imp_sec_expire = cfs_time_current_sec() +
00924                                 SEC_ADAPT_DELAY;
00925                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00926         }
00927 
00928         up_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
00929         EXIT;
00930 }
00931 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_conf_client_adapt);
00932 
00933 
00934 static void rule2string(struct sptlrpc_rule *r, char *buf, int buflen)
00935 {
00936         char     dirbuf[8];
00937         char     net[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE] = "default";
00938         char    *ptr = buf;
00939 
00940         if (r->sr_netid != LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY))
00941                 libcfs_net2str_r(r->sr_netid, net, sizeof(net));
00942 
00943         if (r->sr_from == LUSTRE_SP_ANY && r->sr_to == LUSTRE_SP_ANY)
00944                 dirbuf[0] = '\0';
00945         else
00946                 snprintf(dirbuf, sizeof(dirbuf), ".%s2%s",
00947                          sptlrpc_part2name(r->sr_from),
00948                          sptlrpc_part2name(r->sr_to));
00949 
00950         ptr += snprintf(buf, buflen, "srpc.flavor.%s%s=", net, dirbuf);
00951 
00952         sptlrpc_flavor2name(&r->sr_flvr, ptr, buflen - (ptr - buf));
00953         buf[buflen - 1] = '\0';
00954 }
00955 
00956 static int sptlrpc_record_rule_set(struct llog_handle *llh,
00957                                    char *target,
00958                                    struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset)
00959 {
00960         struct llog_cfg_rec     *lcr;
00961         struct lustre_cfg_bufs   bufs;
00962         char                     param[48];
00963         int                      i, rc;
00964 
00965         for (i = 0; i < rset->srs_nrule; i++) {
00966                 rule2string(&rset->srs_rules[i], param, sizeof(param));
00967 
00968                 lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, NULL);
00969                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, target);
00970                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 2, param);
00971                 lcr = lustre_cfg_rec_new(LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF, &bufs);
00972                 if (lcr == NULL)
00973                         return -ENOMEM;
00974                 rc = llog_write(NULL, llh, &lcr->lcr_hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
00975                 lustre_cfg_rec_free(lcr);
00976                 if (rc)
00977                         return rc;
00978         }
00979         return 0;
00980 }
00981 
00982 static int sptlrpc_record_rules(struct llog_handle *llh,
00983                                 struct sptlrpc_conf *conf)
00984 {
00985         struct sptlrpc_conf_tgt *conf_tgt;
00986 
00987         sptlrpc_record_rule_set(llh, conf->sc_fsname, &conf->sc_rset);
00988 
00989         list_for_each_entry(conf_tgt, &conf->sc_tgts, sct_list) {
00990                 sptlrpc_record_rule_set(llh, conf_tgt->sct_name,
00991                                         &conf_tgt->sct_rset);
00992         }
00993         return 0;
00994 }
00995 
00996 #define LOG_SPTLRPC_TMP "sptlrpc.tmp"
00997 #define LOG_SPTLRPC     "sptlrpc"
00998 
00999 static
01000 int sptlrpc_target_local_copy_conf(struct obd_device *obd,
01001                                    struct sptlrpc_conf *conf)
01002 {
01003         struct llog_handle   *llh = NULL;
01004         struct llog_ctxt     *ctxt;
01005         struct lvfs_run_ctxt  saved;
01006         struct dentry        *dentry;
01007         int                   rc;
01008         ENTRY;
01009 
01010         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01011         if (ctxt == NULL)
01012                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01013 
01014         push_ctxt(&saved, &obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
01015 
01016         dentry = ll_lookup_one_len(MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR, current->fs->pwd.dentry,
01017                                    strlen(MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR));
01018         if (IS_ERR(dentry)) {
01019                 rc = PTR_ERR(dentry);
01020                 CERROR("cannot lookup %s directory: rc = %d\n",
01021                        MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR, rc);
01022                 GOTO(out_ctx, rc);
01023         }
01024 
01025         /* erase the old tmp log */
01026         rc = llog_erase(NULL, ctxt, NULL, LOG_SPTLRPC_TMP);
01027         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENOENT) {
01028                 CERROR("%s: cannot erase temporary sptlrpc log: rc = %d\n",
01029                        obd->obd_name, rc);
01030                 GOTO(out_dput, rc);
01031         }
01032 
01033         /* write temporary log */
01034         rc = llog_open_create(NULL, ctxt, &llh, NULL, LOG_SPTLRPC_TMP);
01035         if (rc)
01036                 GOTO(out_dput, rc);
01037         rc = llog_init_handle(NULL, llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01038         if (rc)
01039                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01040 
01041         rc = sptlrpc_record_rules(llh, conf);
01042 
01043 out_close:
01044         llog_close(NULL, llh);
01045         if (rc == 0)
01046                 rc = lustre_rename(dentry, obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.pwdmnt,
01047                                    LOG_SPTLRPC_TMP, LOG_SPTLRPC);
01048 out_dput:
01049         dput(dentry);
01050 out_ctx:
01051         pop_ctxt(&saved, &obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
01052         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01053         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "target %s: write local sptlrpc conf: rc = %d\n",
01054                 obd->obd_name, rc);
01055         RETURN(rc);
01056 }
01057 
01058 static int local_read_handler(const struct lu_env *env,
01059                               struct llog_handle *llh,
01060                               struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
01061 {
01062         struct sptlrpc_conf  *conf = (struct sptlrpc_conf *) data;
01063         struct lustre_cfg    *lcfg = (struct lustre_cfg *)(rec + 1);
01064         int                   cfg_len, rc;
01065         ENTRY;
01066 
01067         if (rec->lrh_type != OBD_CFG_REC) {
01068                 CERROR("unhandled lrh_type: %#x\n", rec->lrh_type);
01069                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01070         }
01071 
01072         cfg_len = rec->lrh_len - sizeof(struct llog_rec_hdr) -
01073                   sizeof(struct llog_rec_tail);
01074 
01075         rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(lcfg, cfg_len);
01076         if (rc) {
01077                 CERROR("Insane cfg\n");
01078                 RETURN(rc);
01079         }
01080 
01081         if (lcfg->lcfg_command != LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF) {
01082                 CERROR("invalid command (%x)\n", lcfg->lcfg_command);
01083                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01084         }
01085 
01086         RETURN(__sptlrpc_process_config(lcfg, conf));
01087 }
01088 
01089 static
01090 int sptlrpc_target_local_read_conf(struct obd_device *obd,
01091                                    struct sptlrpc_conf *conf)
01092 {
01093         struct llog_handle    *llh = NULL;
01094         struct llog_ctxt      *ctxt;
01095         struct lvfs_run_ctxt   saved;
01096         int                    rc;
01097         ENTRY;
01098 
01099         LASSERT(conf->sc_updated == 0 && conf->sc_local == 0);
01100 
01101         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01102         if (ctxt == NULL) {
01103                 CERROR("missing llog context\n");
01104                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01105         }
01106 
01107         push_ctxt(&saved, &obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
01108 
01109         rc = llog_open(NULL, ctxt, &llh, NULL, LOG_SPTLRPC, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01110         if (rc < 0) {
01111                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
01112                         rc = 0;
01113                 GOTO(out_pop, rc);
01114         }
01115 
01116         rc = llog_init_handle(NULL, llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01117         if (rc)
01118                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01119 
01120         if (llog_get_size(llh) <= 1) {
01121                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "no local sptlrpc copy found\n");
01122                 GOTO(out_close, rc = 0);
01123         }
01124 
01125         rc = llog_process(NULL, llh, local_read_handler, (void *)conf, NULL);
01126 
01127         if (rc == 0) {
01128                 conf->sc_local = 1;
01129         } else {
01130                 sptlrpc_conf_free_rsets(conf);
01131         }
01132 
01133 out_close:
01134         llog_close(NULL, llh);
01135 out_pop:
01136         pop_ctxt(&saved, &obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
01137         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01138         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "target %s: read local sptlrpc conf: rc = %d\n",
01139                 obd->obd_name, rc);
01140         RETURN(rc);
01141 }
01142 
01143 
01148 int sptlrpc_conf_target_get_rules(struct obd_device *obd,
01149                                   struct sptlrpc_rule_set *rset,
01150                                   int initial)
01151 {
01152         struct sptlrpc_conf      *conf;
01153         struct sptlrpc_conf_tgt  *conf_tgt;
01154         enum lustre_sec_part      sp_dst;
01155         char                      fsname[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
01156         int                       rc = 0;
01157         ENTRY;
01158 
01159         if (strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_MDT_NAME) == 0) {
01160                 sp_dst = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
01161         } else if (strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_OST_NAME) == 0) {
01162                 sp_dst = LUSTRE_SP_OST;
01163         } else {
01164                 CERROR("unexpected obd type %s\n", obd->obd_type->typ_name);
01165                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01166         }
01167         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "get rules for target %s\n", obd->obd_uuid.uuid);
01168 
01169         target2fsname(obd->obd_uuid.uuid, fsname, sizeof(fsname));
01170 
01171         mutex_lock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
01172 
01173         conf = sptlrpc_conf_get(fsname, 0);
01174         if (conf == NULL) {
01175                 CERROR("missing sptlrpc config log\n");
01176                 GOTO(out, rc);
01177         }
01178 
01179         if (conf->sc_updated  == 0) {
01180                 /*
01181                  * always read from local copy. here another option is
01182                  * if we already have a local copy (read from another
01183                  * target device hosted on the same node) we simply use that.
01184                  */
01185                 if (conf->sc_local)
01186                         sptlrpc_conf_free_rsets(conf);
01187 
01188                 sptlrpc_target_local_read_conf(obd, conf);
01189         } else {
01190                 LASSERT(conf->sc_local == 0);
01191 
01192                 /* write a local copy */
01193                 if (initial || conf->sc_modified)
01194                         sptlrpc_target_local_copy_conf(obd, conf);
01195                 else
01196                         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "unchanged, skip updating local copy\n");
01197         }
01198 
01199         /* extract rule set for this target */
01200         conf_tgt = sptlrpc_conf_get_tgt(conf, obd->obd_name, 0);
01201 
01202         rc = sptlrpc_rule_set_extract(&conf->sc_rset,
01203                                       conf_tgt ? &conf_tgt->sct_rset: NULL,
01204                                       LUSTRE_SP_ANY, sp_dst, rset);
01205 out:
01206         mutex_unlock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
01207         RETURN(rc);
01208 }
01209 
01210 int  sptlrpc_conf_init(void)
01211 {
01212         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sptlrpc_confs);
01213         mutex_init(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
01214         return 0;
01215 }
01216 
01217 void sptlrpc_conf_fini(void)
01218 {
01219         struct sptlrpc_conf  *conf, *conf_next;
01220 
01221         mutex_lock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
01222         list_for_each_entry_safe(conf, conf_next, &sptlrpc_confs, sc_list)
01223                 sptlrpc_conf_free(conf);
01224         LASSERT(list_empty(&sptlrpc_confs));
01225         mutex_unlock(&sptlrpc_conf_lock);
01226 }
